729198f-b.text:
(1) New Dorp Lane, at the S.W. corner of Cedar Grove Avenue, showing the Britton Cottage, built before 1695.  It stands on land patented to Obadiah Holmes in 1677, transferred in 1695 to Britton.  It also passed through the ownerships of Walton, Cubberly and Miss H. Lord.  Still later Dr. Nathaniel Britton, the botanist, came into possession of the house, who deeded it to the Staten Island Association of Arts and Sciences in 1915.
About 1905
(2) Another view from a different angle.
About 1905.
By Eugene G. Putnam
From Staten Island Museum Collection through P.L. Sperr.

Note: For additional information see "The New York Times", April 16, 1939, Real Estate section, p. 1.
729198f-b.folder: New Dorp Lane & Cedar Grove Avenue, Staten Island, NY
729198f-b.original_title: Richmond: New Dorp Lane - Cedar Grove Avenue

729196f-a.text:
New Dorp Lane, at the o.W. cmne of Cedar Grove
Avenue, show ing the Britton Cottage, built before 1695. The cottage was restored by the W.P. A. in 1939 and made a shrine. For additonal cata see "The New Yohk Timas," April 16, 1939, Real Estate section, p. 1. Che two views were taken the
same year.
About 1W10
Views 1-2
By Mulford Simonson
From P. L. Sperr Collection
